Reviews.Title: “I won't choose this hotel anymore”
Reviews.Author: davide s
Reviews.Content: 11 working days..outside is an orrible cube, inside is quite old; the room maybe is the most beautiful part of the hotel, confortable but it has old fixtures. The gym is a fake and the breakfast is the worst I have ever seen. bathfoam is terrible...the prices are too high; basic room â‚¬ 190 and big suite â‚¬ 350 (is not a joke)

Reviews.Title: “Bad service and amenities for the price.”
Reviews.Author: GKM17
Reviews.Content: The only reason my brother and I stayed at this hotel is because of its proximity to the Echomar hospital, where my brother was a patient. 100 Euros was way out of our budget, but we had to go for it. The room had no clock, no coffee or tea, and you had to pay for water (often included in Turkey because you cannot drink the tap water). The wi-fi connection was poor - I could hardly load pages to find our next hotel! They did grand us an extended check-out time, but they called the room to make sure we were leaving. I found that rude. Also, the walls were not at all soundproof. If you do choose to stay here, you should hope that your neighbors are not feeling amorous.

Reviews.Title: “Got to be part of airport scam...”
Reviews.Author: Vasdoc
Reviews.Content: Missed flight in Istanbul and got this recommended by car rental company. Included shuttle. Cash paid up front-were desperate! Jackhammer in room next door, bathroom filthy, shower/tub didn't work, heat on and broken, need earplugs for traffic noise. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel near the AirPort”
Reviews.Author: matkaman
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Breakfast was good and service also. Hotel has also very good massage clinic and Turkish bath. Only minus is that nothing to do is really near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel dont sleep there”
Reviews.Author: angellights2008
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy!. you have your own transport or get a taxi. The meals in the hotel dining area were not nice and dinner was hugely overpriced. The rooms are in definite need of refurbishment and if you wan't my advice - do not go there. TV dosnt work also the sttaff are good but the receptionist very bad they dont laugh I tray to get help from receptionist but they cant help me . we try to see manager of the hotel but we cant find him . bad breakfast its not fresh I hate this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: Landery
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed. I would rather sleep in the car. Rooms were extremely dirty, staff is very rude, there were mould in the bathroom everywhere and it was even coming out of shower.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, nasty, hot and dated with staff that could care less”
Reviews.Author: bink_79
Reviews.Content: The small group tour represented that we would stay in four star hotels. We arrived to the Adela To meet our group. We found there was garbage in the hallway with roaches running around it.. The room was hot, the carpet was old and dirty, the TV was a 15 inch TV that looked to be about 15 years old, not a nice flat screen. The decor was dated, the sheets were dirty or stained. There was NO mattress pad on the beds which is just plain disgusting. There was something black growing between the sink faucet and the mirror and black mold was all over the corners of the shower. The AC never cooled the room and I slept with a wet towel on my body on top of the dirty sheets. Staff turned Ac off in Lobby at 9 PM. We paid extra to stay at a different hotel away from the group. It would have been free at the Adela, but not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: calhounjohnston
Reviews.Content: An organization introducing me and other Americans to Turkey booked us in at the Adela hotel near the airport. It should not be called a "hotel." While there's a lot of marble on the floors and countertops, that's about the only nice thing in the place. The rooms are small. The air conditioning did not work when it was 90 degrees outside. The noise from a busy highway was unbelievable. The wallpaper was peeling from the wall. The toilet didn't work. The promised wireless Internet connection was spotty at best. In other words, this is a crappy hotel and you don't want to stay here. I got so irritated at this hotel that I left the tour early and booked at a nearby Radisson instead. What a breath of relief it was to stay there. On a 1 out of 10 scale with 1 being the lowest, this hotel gets a negative 5.

Reviews.Title: “Old, dirty, outdated and the most unpleasant staff I've ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: CISSPUK
Reviews.Content: Arriving here the reception is clean and open. That's where the good part ends! I travel extensively for business and the companies I work for always book and pre-pay for the hotels. Arriving here I checked that payment had been received (just a matter of habit) only to be told they hadn't received payment. The staff assured me it would be taken care of. Three days later and after many expensive transatlantic calls and emails I was still be told by both the front desk and the central reservation office that I WAS EXPECTED TO PAY AGAIN!!!!!! All this despite have had my office fax the receipt of the payment and having supplied them with the CC transaction number. They had by the way received payment nearly a week before I arrived. The room is old, no plug in the sink, the grouting between the tiles is old and brown. One wall socket is hanging off with bare wires exposed and the bedside lamp threatens to electrocute you at every touch, There is a mini bar complete with list and NO stock, if you want water .... well you just have to go and find some yourself! All in all this is the worst run, most decrepit hotel it's ever been my misfortune to stay in. Take a tip, sleep on the airport floor, it's cleaner, more modern and the staff are friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, smelly, unfriendly is the best we can say”
Reviews.Author: gemol
Reviews.Content: A change in flight required an overnight stay. The reception seemed very nice, warm offering any help we may need. Floor 8 was dirty, smelly and old. The room was smellier than the hallway. The smell was coming from the drain in the middle of the bathroom. The bath had no plug and it took three telephone calls to the reception and a visit to the reception before any attempt was made to acquire one. Two hours later a friendly little guy arrived with a plug that had obviously been forcibly removed from some other guestâ€™s bath. Gratings hanging off things like bathroom fan (didnâ€™t work) Air conditioner (did not work and visit from â€œtechnical department representativeâ€� never happened). The lack of ac resulted in one of the most uncomfortable nights we have ever experienced. The water pressure was great and plenty of hot water as we discovered when we tried to use the bath. Someone had permanently sealed the bath screen to the bathtub which meant that you had to get into the bath in order to reach the taps! We also discovered that the direction (bath or shower) controller had the wonderful habit of randomly changing from one to the other at the most inconvenient times. We do not know how much hotel stars cost in Turkey but if this place has four then they must be really cheap. Members of staff were sullen and unhelpful but still seemed to expect a gratuity. Stay here at your peril.

Reviews.Title: “Take ear plugs!!”
Reviews.Author: jpward80
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Adela, Istanbul, for nearly 4 weeks. This hotel is rated as 4 star, so on entering the hotel late at night, it looked clean and welcoming. I was welcomed politely and given my key to my 7th floor suite! The bell boy and i, took the lift together with bags, in what can only be described as very small tin can. To close for comfort, if you ask me. This is were the fun started! On entering the 7th floor hall, i found a grubby hall way, and hear what appeared to be people par taking in the own "special" home movie. The horrible fact was that there room was half way down the hall!!! My room was far enough away so wasn't so bad. So now the room. I was placed on the front of the hotel. This frontage looks on to one of the busiest roads i have ever seen. So i closed the windows to stop the noise, not much difference to be honest as the windows are as paper thin as the walls. You can here peoples telephone conversations from other rooms. The room was grubby and the bathroom was very dated, probably as dated as this hotels 4 stars, the bath towels greying with age. The bed was very soft, but the linen was well looked after and changed everyday. Don't open the mini bar $6-7 for a can of coca cola, Beer is the same and don't ask for water. There is no longer a pool in the hotel, so don't be fool by internet adverts. Overall this is a bad hotel Overall this is a bad experience

Reviews.Title: “O.K. for a night rest”
Reviews.Author: mjk97
Reviews.Content: I needed a rest for the early morning flight next day and checked in here around 9pm, after seeing off my wife to her flight in that evening. For 120 euros i paid (including transportation pickup fro/to airport), it was O.K. considering its proximity to the airport (due to Formula One Grand Frix Turkey, airport hotel was all booked). It resembles a setting of city holiday-inn type. I didn't need to eat, but its dining room looked decent, visible from the lobby. Good: Front desk speaks fluent english and staff works efficiently. Free wi-fi, and minibar's water is reasonable at 2 YTL. However, it's the story of Airport's Hotel/transportation agent that one needs to avoid if at all possible (at arrival level and only one there). They quoted this hotel at 160 euros at first. I took a next affordable hotel (Cevsan) at 130 euro (and offered a 10 back). It turned out it's not even worth a 30 euros. After looking at two different rooms there, i had to call back the airport agent and had to threaten to cancel. He offered a so-called free upgrade to this Adela, including all transportations.

HotelInfo.Name: Adela Airport Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Londra Asfalti Uzeri 38, Istanbul 34510, Turkey
